body_html:
Hi @dandelionmane, that looks good as long as it's simple enough to do a single loop over all argument flags to put them in the protobuf.
Looking at the above referenced issue, it would also be good to allow pushing python variables (not tensors) to the existing tabs like Scalars/Histograms/Images. I do it right now with tf.py_func() which is an overkill to add varying python scalars. (Example use case is for monitoring non-tf native python queues.)
Once we have some solution, it would be cool to allow filtering of runs using these hyperparameters too.

body:
Hi @dandelionmane, that looks good as long as it's simple enough to do a single loop over all argument flags to put them in the protobuf.
Looking at the above referenced issue, it would also be good to allow pushing python variables (not tensors) to the existing tabs like Scalars/Histograms/Images. I do it right now with `tf.py_func()` which is an overkill to add varying python scalars. (Example use case is for monitoring non-tf native python queues.)
Once we have some solution, it would be cool to allow filtering of runs using these hyperparameters too.
